intro: Elatinoides, commonly known as the beach morning glory, is a flowering plant belonging to the Convolvulaceae family. It is characterized by its small, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically blue or violet in color. The plant is often found in coastal areas, thriving in sandy or gravelly soils. Elatinoides has a prostrate growth habit, with hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves. It plays an important role in stabilizing dune ecosystems and is adapted to withstand salt spray and strong winds.
